Review Text:
I have ordered Note 8 pro in Feb'20 Battery is good enough, I don't play games, so may be that reason I take 3 days to recharge battery. Camera quality is too good, specially selfi cam quality is awesome. I bought this phone for camera purpose since I m a professional photographer, I like to play with professional cam setting for my desired results, just like the professional cameras. Portraits quality is also good, so more and many fuctions to play with cam.
Too many pre-loaded app for those who are really net savi or Gamers. Gorilla touch screen is very sensitive, finger sensor is too fast.
At this budget I got package of all.
Must buy Phone.

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
The best budget phone under 20k . Have been using this smart phone since a month now & I can't deny the fact that it has amazing camera quality . 64M.P is worth it at the price you are paying for this mobile , even the macro camera is so lit . The details of 64 M.P are so clear while zooming in, even if you click  at very low light places the results are just wooow !!  .
Touch quality is so smooth . It has inbuilt Alexa which makes this device more special. You can ask alexa to play you songs , weather updates & what not.
The dark mode which is  ' I'm fan of ' , is another amazing quality of this phone.  The HD quality of screen is another  amazing thing I loved about this mobile.
The only drawback about this mobile is it's battery life which drains quickly but it can be managed by turning on battery saver.
If I had to rate it overall , I'll rate it 9/10.

Review Title: OUTPERFORMER FOR THE PRICE-A MUST BUY-A TECH LOVERS REVIEW
Review Text:
A user review after using it for 15daysüìÖ I just love checking out new technology. So used this one thoroughly before its review. Hope you guys get a help buying this beauty(üîînews:OnePlus8 will come approx around April 15th-40k approx price)
PRICE-Got it for a deal price of 11.5K üí∏üí∞üí≤approx with exchange offer 6gb_128gbüíª(enough power)
CAMERAS-üì∑Work like a charm (see the clicked pics normal, micro and HDR) Selfies are amazing too. Low light photos are a Lil disappointing, not much.
PROCESSOR-üéÆFast like hell. HELIOp90TüöÄ is an underrated performer (better than the SD720g in 9pro)
BATTERY-üîãBoon for this size 4500 ü•á‚õΩmakes it work for more than a day easily. It will easily take you to late night with heavy use too.
Tip-never let any phone battery drain to zero%. ‚ò†Ô∏èCharge it when it's 15% above to full.‚ö∞Ô∏è
HEPTIC FEED-A very smooth feedbacküé≤ if set to low
OS- the new MIUI 11üéØ is super smooth üïπÔ∏èwith amazing natural sounds and notifications. Ps: their is a notification Led üîîon the front cam üì∏ best thing to get
FORM FACTOR- üìöThe phone is on a heavier side due to its battery(but REDMI NOTE series üí™üì±üòÇ are always heavy) and should be handled with both hands, the glass back phones should be cared well for its fragile nature. Chin is negligible for the price(buy a green or blue version for a seamless experience
HDR SUPPORT-üëÅÔ∏èfor the videos in yt and other platforms for the price is amazing
ALEXA-inbuilt is one of the mind blowing features of 8pro missing in all other phones. üåà‚òî‚ùÑÔ∏èüåçüìΩÔ∏èüìåüìëü§π use it and be smart if not
WEIGHT-üí™ its on the heavier side, I like light small phones(this one is a gift) üòÇüòÇüì±not a deal breaker
VERDICT - If you don't want to spend(waste) your money on expensive phones and buy some needful stuff for you with the money you save.. You should absolutely go for this beast and beauty. Redmi is doing justice to its consumer with such competitive phones.. This phone easily competes with the price range of 20K phones. All in all a must buy for under 15K buyers, don't go anywhere else. Note 9pro is a gimmic, with nothing much inside. Think before you buy.

Review Text:
Awesome device ..... I'm lovin it. It's been more than 6 months I'm using it but still it feels like a new device.
Gaming -
Some Heating Issues are faced during Gaming but thanks to liquid cooling üòåüòå, It helps to cool down very soon.
Processor -
When I was purchasing it, a was having a lil bit of doubt but G90T is very good at the price of 15k. It never felt me feel any type of lag in my device.
üîã Battery üîã -
Can't say much about it ü§îü§î but still it is nice. It easily last long for more than a day if there is no hard usage. But Battery Drainage increases while playing PUBG. But thanks to Fast Charging üòåüòå. Fast Charging works well
Camera -
Camera specifications are the best, say like a flagship device but the software need optimisation.

Only down side is that it is slightly on the heavier side, which is fine for me. All in all an excellent product from Redmi. Worth buying.

Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
Fantastic phone. Using it for past one & half month. No lag till date. Ultrafast fingerprint sensor. Rear Camera quality is good in natural light conditions. Front camera could have been better but OK in this budget. Battery life is sufficient for whole day on moderate use. I will recommend this phone as this is superbly priced as compare to other 64 MP budget smartphones. Gaming experience is superb while playing heavy games. Generates a little heat while playing games bt at acceptable level.
Pros:-
1. Rear camera - 5/5
2. Front camera - 4/5
3. Fingerprint sensor - 5/5
4. Battery life - 4/5
5. Display - 5/5
6. Charging speed :- 5/5
7. Overall Design & looks :-
8.
Cons:-
1. A Little bit heavy & bulky device
2. Ram management is not that great
3. UI advertisements are irritating
4. Hotspot connecting problem to the wifi adapter of my PC. Bt works fine when connects to any phone. Hope it will be resolved with software update.
Overall a value for money camera beast smartphone. Recommend to buy 6/128 GB version.

Review Text:
It's been a month and a half now since I bought this device. Overall performance is awesome if you're thinking of going for a phone within 15k. However-
PROS - The device is fast..never lags
Awesome camera .
It has a powersaver mode for battery. overall the battery life is average 3.5/5.
CONS - Finger print sensor is at a very wrong place.You have to buy a guard for your camera lens or else it degrade overtime because it is right above the finger print sensor.

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Title: It's good if you're only into gaming. But heats a lot.
Review Text:
This mobile is good for gaming, but it's get too hot while playing gaming. I've not used it to play Pubg, but played call of duty, F1 2019 games which are very heavy grafics intensive games. It played well, but gets too hot.
Battery is okay. And camera is above average. Phone is heavy and bulky.
Value for money mobile, if you use it for gaming.

Review Text:
The rear 64 mp camera is real monster..... Such a gem..... 2x zoom is also great..... In lighting conditions the camera is real beast.... In low lighting conditions the camera is pretty good.... The video is bit jerky if you move while recording..... Otherwise if you are standing in one particular position....the 4k video does a pretty good job even in 2x zoom.....
Battery is average...not bad...not so good...
Processor is also fine.....
Overall perfect mid range phone in this price segment...but wait for some more days.... The note 9 pro is coming on its way....
These mi guys are in hurry...

Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Title: Note8Pro review after 1 month of usage
Review Text:
I have used this phone for almost a month now.
This is good phone, few pros and cons as below
Pros:
1. Good in display
2. Touch response is awesome
3. Batter life for normal phone usage along with bit of browsing and 30 min to 1 hr video is fetching 1 complete day. Earlier I was getting 1.5 days
4. Camera looks pretty good. I am still yet to explore the available options
Cons
1. Battery life slowly getting reduced, which is worrying point
2. Sometimes screen gets into landscape mode (now it is) and gets back to portrait mode only when phone is restarted

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
I have been using this phone for around 2 months now and I'm quite happy with the performance of the phone.
The fingerprint scanner is exceptionally fast and has an astute haptic feedback. I was particularly happy with the camera quality. Although the 64MP option is not really useful (as it just eats up all of the disc space), it is really cool to have that feature and the photos taken in the 64MP feature turned on is sharp and crisp and encorporate a lot more details.
The Helio G90T processor is really fast and responsive and works pretty well for gaming and for ordinary day-to-day tasks as well, although it being a 13nm process doesn't really help with the battery life. It lasted me hardly a day and I can't quite complain, considering the fact that I use the phone a lot and do a lot of heavy gaming like PUBG Mobile (the game runs on high graphic settings by default) but if you are a normal user who uses the phone for day-to-day tasks, it would probably last you a day and a half or more. The 18W fast charger provided with the phone charges it pretty quickly considering the 4500 mah battery of the Redmi Note 8 Pro.
Although it has an IPS LCD screen, it's one of the best screens so far with as deep blacks as an AMOLED screen.
All in all, it's an all-rounder of a phone and if you are looking for one that is in the sub-15000 Rs range, then this is definitely a phone that you should check out.

Review Text:
Performance is excellent. Touch and fingerprint sensor is also up to the mark. Sound quality is good. Camera quality is not at all to the mark as presented by company. The pics are blur and it is not acceptable when you have a so called 64 MP camera.
Vidoes are much better than photos. Also slow motion feature is great.
Overall it is a great phone, but purchasing 8GB ram varient is not required. J have 8GB ram varient and so I felt that there is no such difference in performance as compared to a 6GB ram varient.

Review Text:
Things are fine, you may say, for the price.
But
I don't understand why a 4GB Ram Mobile phone gets hanged even without any hi fi games or too many apps on run.
Also, the heat it gets is almost unbearable at times. It makes me feel as though it's about to explode. During the process of charging, don't imagine to even touch your literally burning gadget called Redmi 8 Pro.
The most expensive among the 4 Redmis I have used is, in fact, the worst of it all. Sad!

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Title: Phone's performance is great but it's biggest con is its camera module
Review Text:
Let's start with the screen quality first cause you're gonna most interact through it,
screen quality is great and can be very bright in the outdoor condition so no worry there,
processer is very good high performing graphics games can be played smoothly,
I've only played PUBG on this and it's running on HD graphics default,
one thing about the processor is that though it has liquid cooling but can get hot while playing PUBG for in like 30-45 min,
the biggest con in this device is its camera, the picture quality is pathetic and can't be compared to any other devices, every lens in this module feels like its a gimmick
if you wanna buy a phone and your one of the priority is a camera than go with some other phones.

Overall verdict, quite good phone in the given budget.

Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
Hey guys! I'm a real hardcore user of any phone. I have used Redmi note 8 pro for 15 days in my style. I am not a camera tester but i can tell all about the phone except cameras.
So let me tell you everything that i noticed in some points to let you understand and read easily.
1. Phone looks awesome with 4 cameras and front+back gorilla glass
2. No issues in normal daily usage
3. No lagging while playing any mobile game specially pubg even at extreme settings this phone can handle.
4. Phone gets really too hot while playing games
5. If you play game at higher setting while charging, your phone wont charge.
6. Sound output is not loud enough compared to other phones at this price range.
7. Phone takes forever to charge. almost 2 hours to full charge. IS THAT QUICK CHARGING? NO? because my other phone with normal charger takes equal time.
8. Battery backup is worst. Trust me i didnt expect that. I mean you can call it average but guys its Redmi note 8 pro not other budget phone. battery backup is must. but missing.
I will not recommend to buy this phone.

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
The phone is an overall hit but if you are planning to use it on Wifi frequently the device has some issues,  as of low speed of internet while using the wifi. I have a 50Mbps plan but then it is unable to browse Instagram or twitch etc. Do not waste your money based on the youtube reviews as this device didn't even receive android 10 updates till date. After 3 months of usage, all I can say is that try other available options. The heating issues are resolved after some updates but then the wifi issues are still persisting.
The issue for wifi was checked across numerous devices but only the note 8 pro had the speed issues. MI doesn't give a  damn about their old device as they are busy launching the new one.

Review Text:
Using it from last 4 months.. fingerprint sensor is responsive.
Talking about camera let's not assume as it has quad camera so you'll get two or more cam facing an object at same in one pic...each camera works at one mode at time like macro,wide,ultrawide...let's have look on its prime area of attraction 64MP camera..cannot zoom in 64MP mode.please note it has digital zoom and not optical zoom so image quality will be compromised.
Now processor mediatech helio processor when it comes to performance mobile heats up after gaming more than 10mins..choose wisely..MI can do better than this

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
The phone was bought as a gift and the sad part is it was not liked:-(
Cons:
- This is too bulky to carry, 200gms.
- Moreover, there are too many camera options, and photos don't come out bright when set in auto mode, which hampers the purpose.
- Night mode not so efficient.
- Slow motion recording is a disappointment.
Pros
- Good battery life, goes on till second day with normal use.
- fast charge, a great add !
- 128gb memory, a big space !
- feature rich with Alexa ( have not used though)

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
I'm going to tell you what the reviewers don't. The network on this phone ranges from decent to lousy. On my old Nokia 6.1 Plus, I used to get 4G network in sections of Mumbai that this phone just doesn't manage. Call drops and random silences are another thing. I already got a replacement for this reason alone but the newer phone is no improvement. I narrowly missed the replacement deadline being out of station on work. Then there are irritations like the message tones not changing to what you set ... So no matter what you set, only the default one rings. Yes, Bluetooth plays in LDAC which is nice but the ear piece volume is so low that I have to use the handsfree all the time. Not something that I had a problem with on the Nokia. In fact, my other choice was the Nokia 7.2 and I should have gone for that. Android One and Nokia are indeed a good combination and this glitchy phone reaffirms that.
Ps: the auto brightness also doesn't work properly ... I have to either manually increase it or shade the phone to change the response to the ambient light.

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Title: 1 star review, Not for Amazon or the Seller, Its for Xiaomi/Redmi
Review Text:
Writing review after 1 month, after latest update (MIUI 11.0.2.0 based on android 10) apps getting closed in background, no notification of new messages on WhatsApp, Telegram, and other messaging apps that use internet for communication.
I know this bug will be fixed in the next update, but when we buy a new phone it is expected to work properly on the hardware and software side.
If any of you are seeing this review and thinking of buying this phone please don't trust the software. The hardware is top notch
Good Battery life
Good Camera
Even Mediatek Processor is extremely good
Heating is not an issue for me , I'm a heavy user and use the phone to it's extreme limit.

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Text:
Had given 5 star earlier, now giving 1 only for one reason which is the source country of this product. This review is not about the product but impact on over dependencies on single country for technology and accessories. Few key points here.
1. Purchase trend: Average buying frequency has come down to as less as 6 months, because heavy investment in R&D which is getting marketed slowly. These companies are getting regular money flow from Indian market. Compare 2 scenarios - buying a phone worth 45k and changing after 2 years vs buying 3 phones in 2 years worth 15k each
2. As a manufacturing hub, this country has capitalised almost all brands. In last few days too many people searched this in Google "Phone brands not manufactured in China"
3. Killing the market: Due to high scale and adaptation they are kiiling indian and other market. Apple, Samsung etc will survive but after all they also have manufacturing units there
Phone is good but just one word - boycott. After all I'm and will be at home for some reason. I'll sell it at throwaway or donate or destroy but no point contributing in some one's economy which is destroying the world.
After this post, I'm switching to old spare (non-chinese) phone which will be more satisfying.
JAGO GRAHAK JAGO.

Product Title: Redmi Note 8 Pro (Gamma Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage with Helio G90T Processor)
Review Title: Not the beast as advertised by redmi!
Review Text:
The phone is not the beast as it is advertised. Below are the issues.
1. Network issue whenever you are switching from wi-fi to the mobile internet the connection never works. You need to make the airplane mode active before the net is activated.
2. The battery is advertised as massive but it drains qucikly I had redmi note 6 pro with 4000mah battery and the performance I observed was better.
3. Have the 6 GB version still sometimes for few application the performance is not adequate.
4. The camera although portrayed as the best but the quality is not impressive aa advertised.
